candidates.title: [3.10] gh-80222: Fix email address header folding with long quoted-string (GH-122753)
candidates.body:
Email generators using email.policy.default could incorrectly omit the
quote ('"') characters from a quoted-string during header refolding,
leading to invalid address headers and enabling header spoofing. This
change restores the quote characters on a bare-quoted-string as the
header is refolded, and escapes backslash and quote chars in the string.
(cherry picked from commit 5aaf4168583)

Co-authored-by: Mike Edmunds <medmunds@gmail.com>


<!-- gh-issue-number: gh-80222 -->
* Issue: gh-80222
<!-- /gh-issue-number -->

candidates.title: [3.12] gh-112919: Speed-up datetime, date and time.replace() (GH-112921)
candidates.body:
Use argument clinic and call new_* functions directly. This speeds up
these functions 6x to 7.5x when calling with keyword arguments.
(cherry picked from commit 1f515e8a109204f7399d85b7fd806135166422d9)

Co-authored-by: Eugene Toder <eltoder@users.noreply.github.com>

candidates.title: [3.12] gh-109860: Use a New Thread State When Switching Interpreters, When Necessary (gh-110245)
candidates.body:
In a few places we switch to another interpreter without knowing if it has a thread state associated with the current thread.  For the main interpreter there wasn't much of a problem, but for subinterpreters we were *mostly* okay re-using the tstate created with the interpreter (located via PyInterpreterState_ThreadHead()).  There was a good chance that tstate wasn't actually in use by another thread.

However, there are no guarantees of that.  Furthermore, re-using an already used tstate is currently fragile.  To address this, now we create a new thread state in each of those places and use it.

One consequence of this change is that PyInterpreterState_ThreadHead() may not return NULL (though that won't happen for the main interpreter).

(cherry-picked from commit f5198b09e16bca1886f8245fa88203d07d51ec11)

<!-- gh-issue-number: gh-109860 -->
* Issue: gh-109860
<!-- /gh-issue-number -->
